intro: Pedicularis longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats at high altitudes. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
